definition: surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse

sentences.english: So do the corpses in the streets and the ones waiting for identification in the morgue.
sentences.chinese: 还有那些街上的尸体，那些在太平间等着认领的陈尸。

sentences.english: Are we in intensive care or the morgue ?
sentences.chinese: 出版业目前在深切治疗中还是已经陈尸停尸间呢？

sentences.english: Oxford Black series. An Englishman is found dead in his apartment.
sentences.chinese: 一个英国人被发现陈尸在自己的公寓里。

sentences.english: With no one allowed to hold funerals, bodies are being stored in makeshift morgues.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都不允许举办葬礼，遗体被存储在临时陈尸所。

sentences.english: But I can't sleep. It's like going to sleep in a morgue.
sentences.chinese: 可是我无法入睡，这简直如同在陈尸所里睡觉一样。

definition: to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
